hasDefinedTerm.name: Conversion Rate
hasDefinedTerm.description: The percentage of visitors who complete a desired action on an e-commerce site

hasDefinedTerm.name: Average Order Value
hasDefinedTerm.description: The average amount spent each time a customer places an order

hasDefinedTerm.name: Customer Lifetime Value
hasDefinedTerm.description: The total revenue a business can expect from a single customer account

hasDefinedTerm.name: Cart Abandonment Rate
hasDefinedTerm.description: The percentage of online shopping carts that are abandoned before purchase completion

mainEntity.name: What types of e-commerce statistics are most important for business decisions?

acceptedAnswer.text: Key e-commerce statistics include conversion rates, average order value, customer acquisition cost, customer lifetime value, cart abandonment rates, and traffic sources. These metrics help businesses understand performance and identify optimization opportunities.

mainEntity.name: How often should e-commerce businesses review their statistics?

acceptedAnswer.text: E-commerce businesses should monitor key metrics daily for operational insights, review comprehensive statistics weekly for trend analysis, and conduct deep statistical analysis monthly or quarterly for strategic planning.

mainEntity.name: What are industry benchmarks for e-commerce conversion rates?

acceptedAnswer.text: E-commerce conversion rates vary by industry, but generally range from 1-4%. Fashion and apparel typically see 1-2%, while electronics and consumer goods may achieve 2-4%. Understanding your industry benchmarks helps set realistic goals.

mainEntity.name: How can statistics help improve e-commerce performance?

acceptedAnswer.text: Statistics provide data-driven insights for optimization, helping identify bottlenecks in the customer journey, understand customer behavior patterns, measure marketing effectiveness, and make informed decisions about inventory, pricing, and user experience improvements.
